title: 109_hr517
content: The Act titled "Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Reauthorization Act of 2005" reauthorizes the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments to various sections. Additionally, the authority to resume receipt of 25- or 50-percent payments is clarified. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments to various sections including adjustments to 25- and 50-percent payments. The Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 is extended through fiscal year 2013, with amendments to various sections including adjustments to payments from national forest lands. The Secretary of the Treasury will allow counties to elect to receive the 50-percent payment starting from fiscal year 2007. The amendment allows for the reservation of certain revenues for payments to eligible counties from BLM lands in case of a shortfall in a fiscal year. The amendment allows for the reservation of certain revenues for payments to eligible counties from BLM lands in case of a shortfall in a fiscal year. The term for Resource Advisory Committee Members is also addressed, allowing for reappointment for one or more terms. The amendment allows for the reservation of revenues for county payments from BLM lands in case of a shortfall. It also addresses the reappointment of Resource Advisory Committee Members for one or more terms. The amendment modifies notification and reporting requirements for county projects under the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000. It includes provisions for pilot programs and redesignates subparagraphs. The participating county must notify the Secretary concerned within 90 days after the fiscal year ends about projects where county funds were used. The notification should include project details, authorized use, and the amount of county funds spent. The Secretary will review the notifications submitted for each fiscal year. The Secretary concerned will prepare an annual report with the results of the review of county notifications for each fiscal year. The report must be submitted to specific Senate and House committees within 150 days after the fiscal year ends. The term 'Secretary concerned' is defined as the Secretary of Agriculture or the Secretary of the Interior, or their designees, for the purpose of county funds reserved for expenditure in accordance with the mentioned title. Technical Correction: Amend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000 by changing references from "An eligible county" to "A participating county" and from "A county" to "A participating county". Additionally, remove the comma after "the Secretary concerned may" in Section 205(a)(3).
